questions.question: What does C refers to in AC3 Temperature:

explanations.a: Chauffage refers to heating, not the critical temperature designation.
explanations.b: Chauffer means to heat in French, but is not used here.
explanations.c: C in AC3 denotes the critical temperature at which austenite formation is complete.
explanations.d: Condensing has no relevance in heat treatment.

questions.question: Water cooling rate is _______ to critical cooling rate:

explanations.a: Water provides a cooling rate higher than the critical cooling rate required for martensite formation.
explanations.b: Lower cooling rate would not form martensite.
explanations.c: Equal cooling rate is not practically observed.
explanations.d: Incorrect because water cooling is higher.

questions.question: Fast cooling results in formation of:

explanations.b: Austenite exists only at high temperature.
explanations.c: Martensite forms due to rapid quenching.

questions.question: Slow cooling is carried out by:

explanations.a: Air provides the slowest cooling rate.
explanations.d: Slow cooling is possible using air.
